lead_paragraph: After Munich, we’re asking what kind of violence poses the greater danger to our self-identity: the Islamic State, or the German far right?

headline.main: Germany, Caught Between Two Violent Extremes

snippet: After Munich, we’re asking what kind of violence poses the greater danger to our self-identity: the Islamic State, or the German far right?...
abstract: Anna Sauerbrey Op-Ed column contends series of violent attacks in Germany have raised twin specters of global terrorism and internal right-wing extremism that have together shaken very  character of Germany; says simple truth is that while there is no easy answer to crises that threaten to destroy nation's hard-won, tolerant, cosmopolitan identity, any answer must come from Germans themselves.
